Article Title: Stolen Chola-era idol of Krishna brought home from Bangkok
Article Text: CHENNAI: An exquisitely cast antique Chola-era bronze idol of 'Kaliya (cobra) Krishna ' or 'Kalinga Nardhana Krishna' (dancing Krishna), smuggled out of the country several years ago and recovered in Bangkok , was returned to India and handed over to Archaeological Survey of India (ASI).In a letter dated Aug 14, director-antiquity, ASI, informed Shailesh Kumar Yadav, then DGP Idol Wing CID, that it received the idol (from Bangkok) on June 25 and was in its 'safe custody'."As the sculpture is a case property, the competent authority has agreed to hand over the sculpture to Idol Wing, Tamil Nadu," said the letter, asking Yadav to depute a team "to take over the object"."Due to shoddy probes in India, despite idol smuggler Subhash Kapoor being extradited to the country and a lengthy trial, no leads were forthcoming on even a single idol of the thousands he had stolen and sold for past 35 years," said idol hunter and India Pride Project co-founder K Vijay Kumar. "It was by sheer luck the bronze surfaced with another noted antique smuggler and collector Douglas Latchford in Bangkok," said Kumar."India must open a larger probe into the Latchford idols and push for all their restitution as well," he said. "Social media photos show at least eight other Chola bronzes in Latchford's Bangkok apartment. India should seek their return as well," he said."Once provided proof that this Kaliyanardhana was trafficked, the now deceased smuggler's daughter agreed to return the statue to India," he added.
Article Summary: An antique Chola-era bronze idol of 'Kaliya (cobra) Krishna'or 'Kalinga Nardhana Krishna' (dancing Krishna) was returned to India. The idol was smuggled out of the country several years ago and recovered in Bangkok. Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) handed over the sculpture to Idol Wing, Tamil Nadu.

Article Title: Woman, lover given life term for husband's murder in 2020
Article Text: Agra: A local court in Aligarh has sentenced a 40-year-old woman and her lover to life imprisonment on Friday for murder of her husband four years ago, reports Mohammad Dilshad.Additional district govt counsel Swarnlata Verma said, "The court of additional district judge Rajesh Kumar has also imposed a fine of Rs 30,000 on each of the convicts. The murder had occurred on Dec 4, 2020, in Chandaniya Colony under the Quarsi police station jurisdiction."Ganga Prasad, of Chandaniya, said his son, Satish Kumar (30), had married Saroj, wife of a neighbour, five years ago.Saroj, a mother of four, was living with Satish since their marriage. During this time, she became involved with one Kapil Kumar. Saroj, with Kapil's assistance, strangled Satish to death. After an extensive probe and legal proceedings, court found both Saroj and Kapil guilty of murder."Following the investigation, Saroj and Kapil were arrested, and they remained in jail until their sentencing on Friday," the ADGC added.
Article Summary: Saroj, a mother of four, was living with Satish since their marriage. Saroj, with Kapil's assistance, strangled Satish to death. After an extensive probe and legal proceedings, court found both Saroj and Kapil guilty of murder.

Article Title: Gujarat House nod to bill for special courts to seize illegal assets
Article Text: GANDHINAGAR: Gujarat assembly on Friday passed a bill that provides for setting up of special courts to crack down on disproportionate assets of govt employees, bootleggers, GST scamsters, land mafia, drug mafia and even elected representatives.Introducing Gujarat Special Courts Bill, 2024, minister of state for home Harsh Sanghavi said special courts will be set up to handle cases in which the prescribed prison term exceeds three years and DAs amount to more than Rs 1 crore.According to the bill, accumulation of property through unlawful means and then using such property to expand criminal activities called for setting up of special courts for expeditious confiscation of properties identified with the criminal case.An IO will make an application to an authorised officer, who will be a retired additional session judge of the special court. After due process of issuing notices and conducting a hearing, the court will empower state govt to confiscate property acquired through illegal means. TNN
Article Summary: Gujarat assembly passes bill to set up special courts to crack down on disproportionate assets of govt employees, bootleggers, GST scamsters, land mafia, drug mafia and even elected representatives. Special courts will be set up to handle cases in which prescribed prison term exceeds three years and DAs amount to over Rs 1 crore.

Article Title: HC grants bail to Mukhtar Ansari's MLA son in sale-deed case
Article Text: Allahabad high court on Friday granted bail to Abbas Ansari , MLA and son of gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari , in a matter where a sale deed was allegedly executed forcefully at gunpoint. The same day, Supreme Court adjourned hearing on Abbas' bail plea in a case of him allegedly meeting his wife illegally in Chitrakoot jail .
Article Summary: Allahabad high court granted bail to Abbas Ansari, MLA and son of gangster- turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari. Supreme Court adjourned hearing on Abbas' bail plea in a case of him allegedly meeting his wife illegally in Chitrakoot jail.

Article Title: Former Congress MLA gets 47 months in jail for flouting Covid norms during 2022 poll drive
Article Text: MEERUT: An MP/MLA court in Bulandshahr sentenced former Congress MLA from Khurja , Bansi Singh Pahadiya, to three years and 11 months imprisonment for breaching the model code of conduct and flouting Covid-19 guidelines during the 2022 assembly election campaign. Special judge Vinay Kumar Singh also imposed a fine of Rs 50,000 on Pahadiya.Special public prosecutor Hitendra Verma said Pahadiya, who had joined SP, contested the 2022 state polls as SP-RLD alliance candidate."On Feb 3, 2022, Pahadiya organised an election rally with a convoy of 30 to 40 cars and bikes, with 400-450 people shouting slogans and beating drums. The crowd, without face masks, flouted Covid guidelines. Permission was not taken for the election rally," said Verma."A case was registered against Pahadiya in Khurja Nagar police station. The case was tried in the MP/MLA special court, where Pahadiya was convicted on Thursday under sections of Uttar Pradesh Public Health and Epidemic Act, the Disaster Management Act 2005, Epidemic Amendment 2020, and other relevant laws. He has been sent to jail under judicial custody," he added.
Article Summary: Bansi Singh Pahadiya, a former Congress MLA from Khurja, was sentenced to three years and 11 months imprisonment. Special judge Vinay Kumar Singh also imposed a fine of Rs 50,000 on Pah ADiya. PahADiya contested the 2022 state polls as SP- RLD alliance candidate.

Article Title: Bandh will hit normal life, no party shall enforce it: Bombay High Court
Article Text: MUMBAI: MVA on Friday called off its statewide bandh on Saturday over the Badlapur school sexual abuse case after Bombay HC, pointing at the "huge loss" to the economy and disruption of essential services like health that would occur, restrained all parties concerned from proceeding with the general strike.MVA constituents Shiv Sena (UBT), NCP (SP) and Congress decided that instead of the total bandh, all their politicians would wear black badges and resort to sit-in protests across the state.Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray and NCP (SP) president Sharad Pawar said they disagreed with the view of the high court but were following the order out of respect for the judiciary.CM Eknath Shinde called HC direction a slap on the face of the opposition and said MVA was milking the Badlapur incident in the hope of gaining votes in the assembly election after seeing the popularity of the Ladki Bahin scheme of govt.The order of HC bench of Chief Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya and Justice Amit Borkar came on two PILs filed by daily wager Nandabai Misal and advocates Jaishri Patil and Gunaratan Sadavarte.Initially, HC bench had been disinclined to interfere in the matter, saying the court "should not be dragged in and politicised" when there existed a state machinery to prevent the bandh.The PILs expressed concern about the adverse consequences citizens and organisations, including students, small and big businesses, and taxi and autorickshaw drivers, were likely to suffer because of the bandh.For Misal, advocates Subhash Jha and Harekrishna Mishra referred to the statewide Maratha agitation that had led to destruction of public and private properties and urged HC to intervene.Sadavarte said protests were being planned despite an SIT having been set up in the Badlapur case. "For 10 hours ... stone-pelting for justice? It was for their own mileage," he said.To the bench's query on preventive steps taken, advocate general Birendra Saraf said notices had been issued to the bandh organisers but arrests were not yet made. "While the state is taking all steps to ensure there is no disruption, the constitutional obligations of others not to call for a bandh should also be enforced," he said.The judges said from the material available they were prima facie convinced that the call given by political parties to observe the bandh would mean "cessation of all kinds of activities, which will result in the life of the state coming to a halt". They said it may entail heavy loss to industrial, business, economic and other activities.They said the bandh was likely to not only affect students but also adversely impact emergency services such as health and public conveniences like electricity, water, local trains and "entire life of Mumbai may come to a halt".
Article Summary: Bombay HC restrained all parties concerned from proceeding with the general strike. MVA constituents Shiv Sena (UBT), NCP (SP) and Congress decided that instead of the total bandh, all their politicians would wear black badges. PILs expressed concern about the adverse consequences citizens and organisations were likely to suffer.

Article Title: Hyderabad influencer arrested for cash stunt
Article Text: A Hyderabad-based 'influencer' was arrested Friday after his latest stunt of throwing cash in the air while driving through crowded streets caused traffic chaos in Kukatpally . He was remanded to 14-day judicial custody, police said, reports Amisha Rajani."Suo motu cases were registered against the accused - identified as Korapathi Vamshi (23), with Instagram name Harsha - at KPHB, Kukatpally and Sanathnagar police stations of Cyberabad.He has been charged with creating nuisance on the road, rash and negligent acts, and obstruction of traffic movement," said Shiva Bhaskar, ACP, Kukatpally division. Multiple videos of Harsha - popular as 'its me power' on Instagram went viral on social media, garnering over 27 million views. In a previous post, he is seen buying large quantities of liquor and distributing it on the streets, drawing criticism from his followers. Another video shows him offering fuel to 30 people with a cap amount of Rs 1,000.
Article Summary: Hyderabad-based 'influencer' was arrested Friday after his latest stunt of throwing cash in the air while driving through crowded streets caused traffic chaos. Multiple videos of Harsha - popular as 'its me power' on Instagram went viral on social media, garnering over 27 million views.

Article Title: Army drone on recon mission strays across LoC into Pakistan
Article Text: NEW DELHI: A small tactical unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAV ) of the Indian Army inadvertently strayed across the LoC into Pakistan-occupied Kashmir on Friday. An officer said the drone was on a training mission when its control was lost due to a technical snag and it drifted into POK 's Nikial sector.A message has been sent to Pakistan Army over the hotline between the DGs of military operations seeking the return of the 'Switch' fixed-wing VTOL (vertical take-off and landing) UAV which is deployed by infantry battalions for surveillance operations.However, reports say Pakistan has shot down the "mini drone".Both India and Pakistan regularly deploy small and large UAVs for surveillance along the 778-km long LoC, as is also the practice along the 3,488-km Line of Actual Control with China. Pakistan for the last several years has also been using small drones to courier weapons, explosives and drugs to Punjab and J&K from across the border.
Article Summary: A small tactical unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAV ) of the Indian Army inadvertently strayed across the LoC into Pakistan-occupied Kashmir on Friday. An officer said the drone was on a training mission when its control was lost due to a technical snag and it drifted into POK's Nikial sector.

Article Title: 5 killed after roof collapses in MP
Article Text: INDORE: Five men - a contractor and four labourers - were killed in their sleep when a roof they had laid less than two days earlier caved in on them at an under-construction resort near Indore early Friday morning. Two of those killed were brothers.The victims were building a cottage for the resort in Choral village of Mhow tehsil, around 32km from the district headquarters on the Indore-Ichhapur highway.It was raining hard on Thursday night, which led the victims to take shelter in the half-built cottage. Heavy showers could have weakened the newly laid concrete slab and it collapsed early on Friday. The accident was discovered in the morning.SP-rural Hitika Vasal told TOI the guard saw the collapsed structure and alerted cops. "The exact time of the accident is yet to be ascertained," she said.Heavy machines were deployed to reach the victims. Five bodies were pulled out from the rubble, Vasal said.Four of the labourers had clicked a selfie with the roof after casting it on Wednesday afternoon. One of them joined work a day later. Police were registering a case against four people for causing death by negligence. tnn
Article Summary: The victims were building a cottage for the resort in Choral village of Mhow tehsil. It was raining hard on Thursday night, which led the victims to take shelter in the half-built cottage. Heavy showers could have weakened the newly laid concrete slab and it collapsed early on Friday.

Article Title: 4 from Nepal die as Uttarakhand wall falls
Article Text: Four men from Nepal died after being trapped under debris when a wall collapsed following a landslide triggered by heavy overnight rainfall at Phata village in Rudraprayag district early on Friday. It took an SDRF team several hours to retrieve the bodies.Tul Bahadur, Purna Nepali, Kishan Parihar, and Chiku Bura, all residents of Chiton Oil in Nepal's Narayani district died after being trapped under debris following a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall in Rudraprayag district of Uttarakhand .
Article Summary: Tul Bahadur, Purna Nepali, Kishan Parihar, and Chiku Bura, all residents of Chiton Oil in Nepal's Narayani district died after being trapped under debris. It took an SDRF team several hours to retrieve the bodies.

Article Title: Interior designer missing for one week killed, his body dumped in river
Article Text: Ghaziabad : A 34-year-old interior designer who was reported missing by his family a week ago was allegedly murdered , his body chopped into six parts and dumped into a river in Bulandshahr.Tarun Panwar, a resident of KW Srishti apartment in Raj Nagar Extension, went missing on Aug 16. Police said they were yet to recover Tarun's body.A man detained in connection with the murder claimed Tarun was murdered over money.Cops are also on the lookout for four other suspects. A complaint submitted by his father Ravinder Kumar said Tarun had received a call around 11 am on Aug 16 and left home to meet that person but never returned. He suspected Tarun had been kidnapped."Around 5-6 pm, we called to enquire after him. His phone rang, but he didn't pick up. We thought he was on his way home, so he had not taken the calls. Nearly 30 minutes later, we called again. This time his phone was switched off. It was unlikely of Tarun to not call back and switch off his phone, but we waited for some time. We started calling his friends and acquaintances when he did not switch on his phone. We called over 35 people, but none of them knew where Tarun could be," Kumar said.DCP Rajesh Kumar said after Kumar submitted a complaint at Nandgram police station, an FIR was registered under the BNS section 140 (1) (kidnapping or abducting in order to murder).Tarun's car was recovered near Yashoda Hospital late on Aug 16 night, while call record analysis showed his phone was switched off in Morta.A man detained on the basis of call records and other intelligence inputs claimed Tarun's body was chopped into six parts before being dumped into a river in Bulandshahr. "Three teams are trying to trace his body," the DCP said.Police sources told TOI said the suspect had continuously changed his statement. He has named at least four more people who could be involved in the crime, they said.
Article Summary: Tarun Panwar, a resident of KW Srishti apartment in Raj Nagar Extension, went missing on Aug 16. Police said they were yet to recover Tarun's body. A man detained in connection with the murder claimed Tarun was murdered over money.

Article Title: Probe graft charges against RG Kar ex-principal: Kolkata High Court to CBI
Article Text: KOLKATA: Calcutta high court asked CBI on Friday to take over the probe into corruption charges against RG Kar Medical College 's ex-principal Sandip Ghosh from an SIT constituted by the Bengal govt, saying it makes sense to have one agency look into all allegations against him.Allegations of financial and administrative impropriety have been piling up against Ghosh, already under investigation by CBI for his actions following the Aug 9 rape-murder of a junior doctor on campus.Justice Rajarshi Bharadwaj directed the SIT set up earlier this week to transfer all relevant documents to CBI by 10am Saturday, and directed the central agency to file a progress report on Sept 17."The investigations (into the rape-murder at RG Kar hospital and the graft charges against the ex-principal) should not be fragmented between different agencies. Handing over the investigation to the CBI ensures consistency," states the court's 12-page order. "Multiple agencies handling different aspects of the case could lead to inefficiencies or inconsistencies, unnecessary delays and potential misinterpretation of information."Justice Bharadwaj's order came on a petition filed by RG Kar hospital's ex-deputy superintendent Akhtar Ali, seeking an ED investigation into alleged corruption involving Ghosh. He said nothing came of his complaints against Ghosh with the anti-corruption branch and the West Bengal Human Rights Commission last year.When the state's counsel Amitesh Banerjee argued against giving the probe to CBI, Justice Bharadwaj sought to know why the govt waited until Aug 16 to set up the SIT when a complaint about irregularities at RG Kar was filed in 2023.Ali's lawyer Tarunjyoti Tewari mentioned in his submission allegations of corruption in disposal of medical at the hospital and also the "disappearance" of a body from the morgue on Jan 11 last year.Govt counsel Banerjee said setting up the SIT was an "autonomous decision, unrelated and unconnected" to Ali's complaint. The SIT, comprising four senior IPS officers, was tasked with probing irregularities at the state-run hospital since Jan 2021, he pointed out.Ghosh's counsel Biswaroop Bhattacharya challenged Justice Bharadwaj's order before a division bench of justices Harish Tandon and Hiranmay Bhattacharyya, saying it was issued without giving his client a hearing. The court asked him to approach a regular bench.
Article Summary: CBI asked to take over probe into corruption charges against RG Kar Medical College's ex-principal Sandip Ghosh. Calcutta high court says it makes sense to have one agency look into all allegations against him. Ghosh already under investigation by CBI for his actions following the Aug 9 rape-murder of a junior doctor on campus.

Article Title: UP's mammoth police exam begins: 48 Lakh vie for 60k posts
Article Text: LUCKNOW: UP 's police constable recruitment exam, billed the largest ever job test in the state's history with 48 lakh aspirants vying for 60,244 posts, kicked off Friday without any big troubles. This is a re-exam following the cancellation of the previous test in Feb 2024 after a leak. Four more rounds of the test are slated for Aug 24, 25, 30 and 31, reports Pathikrit Chakraborty.Nearly 21% candidates skipped the test on Friday, while 61 people were arrested for allegedly impersonating during the exams conducted at 1,174 centres across 67 districts in two shifts.Overall, 8.2 lakh students had downloaded admit cards for Friday's test, but almost 6.5 lakh finally appeared.DGP Prashant Kumar visited several exam centres, monitored with drones and equipped with CCTV cameras and mobile jammers to prevent unauthorised communication. To ensure a cheating-free environment, magistrates were appointed at each centre. Over 2,100 buses of UPSRTC were deployed for ferrying students to exam centres.
Article Summary: Nearly 21% candidates skipped the test on Friday, while 61 people were arrested for allegedly impersonating during the exams. This is a re-exam following the cancellation of the previous test in Feb 2024 after a leak. Four more rounds of the test are slated for Aug 24, 25, 30 and 31.

Article Title: High Court relief for students in Stephen's row
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Coming to the rescue of students stranded due to a dispute over CUET admissions between Delhi University and St Stephen's College , Delhi High Court on Friday granted provisional admission to six candidates in the college.The court noted that there was no fault of the six students who had successfully cleared the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) and other formalities to be allotted St Stephen's College as per their given choice, yet were unable to secure their admissions due to the "policy dispute" between the university and the college."In these peculiar circumstances, without there being any fault on the part of the present petitioners and despite them being meritorious and having cleared all the formalities and tests, they are being kept under suspense regarding the fate of their admission. Such circumstances, where their future prospects of studying in the college of their choice are being compromised due to the policy-related disputes of respondent no. 1 (DU) and respondent no. 3 (St Stephen's College), will require judicial intervention, in the interest of the petitioners," Justice Swarana Kanta Sharma noted in an interim order.The court pointed out that the six students, represented by senior advocate Rishi Malhotra, were allocated St Stephen's as the college of their preference and choice as per DU's policy and after clearing CUET and other formalities.It observed that even while counselling has begun and will conclude by Aug 25, the online applications of the petitioners have neither been rejected nor accepted by the college, and their applications are still "under process" on DU's admission portal."In view thereof, this court directs that the petitioners herein will be granted provisional admission" in the college, as per allocation by DU, the court said, grantinginterim relief .It further noted that in case the petitioners do not succeed eventually in their plea, they may lose the prospect of securing admission in even the second choice of college. It therefore directed the university to open its portal for depositing fees, only for the six petitioners, on Aug 24 between 10:00 am and 4:00 pm.On its part, the college informed the court that it had only three seats for BA (Program) and blamed DU for instead allocating 19 candidates for the course in the college. However, DU's counsel said the university would file a detailed reply, accusing the college of raising frivolous objections, and reiterating that the college is duty-bound to comply with the allocation list issued by the university.
Article Summary: Delhi High Court on Friday granted provisional admission to six candidates in the college. Court noted that there was no fault of the six students who had successfully cleared the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) The college informed the court that it had only three seats for BA (Program)

Article Title: ED mounts probe into Qaida link in Jharkhand land scam
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Enforcement Directorate has started probing the al-Qaida link in Jharkhand's land scam case in which CM Hemant Soren was arrested earlier and is one of the accused in its money laundering case. ED has summoned Babloo Khan, who runs a hospital in Ranchi, on Monday after it was found that an al-Qaida cell busted by the Delhi Police special cell Thursday had employed members of the suspected terror module.Babloo Khan is brother of Afsar Ali, arrested by ED in April from Ranchi in the land scam case. According to sources, the hospital Khan was running in Ranchi was registered in the name of Ishtiaq Ahmed, an al-Qaida suspect who was arrested in a joint operation by the Delhi Police special cell and the Special Task Force (STF) of Jharkhand Police on Thursday.Ahmed is a radiologist like Afsar Ali and both worked in the hospital run by Babloo Khan, sources said. Ahmed was arrested as the prime suspect behind an al-Qaida cell called al-Qaida in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) that had members across Jharkhand, Haryana and Rajasthan.Afsar Ali and five of his associates, including Md Saddam Hussain, were arrested in April for their role in forgery, tampering and fabrication of land records and registering them in the name of beneficiaries of the land scam. "During investigation, active involvement of govt officials of land revenue department located in Ranchi and Kolkata had surfaced. Some of the lands acquired through such falsification and forgery by the above accused are under illegal possession of CM Hemant Soren," ED had said following the arrest of Afsar Ali.Jharkhand HC on June 28 had ordered Soren's release on bail, observing that "none of the registers/revenue records" cited by ED in its land scam and money laundering probe "bear imprint of the direct involvement of the petitioner".
Article Summary: Babloo Khan is brother of Afsar Ali, arrested by ED in April in the land scam case. The hospital Khan was running in Ranchi was registered in the name of Ishtiaq Ahmed. Ahmed was arrested as the prime suspect behind an al-Qaida cell. Jharkhand HC on June 28 had ordered Soren's release on bail.

Article Title: Supreme Court to hear Arvind Kejriwal pleas on September 6
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Seeking dismissal of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal 's bail plea in the excise policy case, CBI in an affidavit told the Supreme Court on Friday that he had masterminded increase in wholesalers' commission from 5% to 12% in the 2021-22 excise policy in return for alleged Rs 100 crore in kickbacks, of which Rs 45 crore was sent through hawala for AAP 's Goa election campaign.The agency also opposed grant of interim bail to Kejriwal on health grounds and said he could be treated for his ailments in the jail hospital or any referral hospital as per the jail manual.Additional solicitor general S V Raju told a bench of Justices Surya Kant and Ujjal Bhuyan that this affidavit was in response to one of the two petitions filed by Kejriwal and sought a week's time to file reply to the other petition. Kejriwal 's counsel, senior advocate A M Singhvi, told the bench that CBI was deliberately delaying the hearing before SC. The bench asked CBI to file the other affidavit within a week and posted Kejriwal's two petitions for hearing on Sep 6.CBI said it had arrested Kejriwal on April 26 in the corruption case relating to the excise scam after receiving the Delhi LG's approval under Section 17A of Prevention of Corruption Act on April 23 to proceed against him. Enforcement Directorate had arrested him on March 21 in a money laundering case relating to the liquor scam."Kejriwal, in connivance with other accused, deliberately tweaked/manipulated the excise policy 2021-22 and hiked profit margin of liquor wholesalers from 5% to 12% without any rationale, causing undue windfall gains to the wholesalers in lieu of an illegal gratification of Rs 100 crore from the South Group, to meet the election related expenses of AAP in Goa," CBI said.The agency said though the Delhi CM did not hold any ministerial portfolio, "all decisions of the govt as well as the party are taken on his concurrence and directions. These include not only the decisions in Delhi, but also throughout the country where AAP is present".CBI said Kejriwal's overarching control over AAP was evident from the fact that at his behest, AAP govt in Punjab had refused permission to the agency to investigate state govt officials. "Mahadev Liquors, the third largest wholesaler in Delhi and having a substantial presence in Punjab, had refused for recoupment of maximum profits in Delhi excise policy. This led to its distilleries being closed. Only on surrendering licences of its manufacturers were the distilleries reopened. Such action raises reasonable suspicion of influence being exerted by Kejriwal, who is also AAP national convenor," CBI said.The central agency said the expert committee in 2020 had drafted an excise policy for Delhi proposing a govt corporation-owned wholesale model and allotment of maximum two retail shops in an area through lottery system, which did not suit Kejriwal's preconceived idea.After then deputy CM Manish Sisodia drafted a new excise policy, CM-led cabinet constituted a group of ministers in Feb 2021 to study the draft and recommend a new excise policy. "In the first draft of the GoM report of March 15, 2021, retrieved from Sisodia's official computer, a profit margin of 5% for wholesalers was prescribed," CBI said.But CM, in connivance with South Group, on March 18, 2021, enhanced wholesalers' margin from 5% to 12% , which was incorporated in the final GoM report of March 22, 2021. The Delhi cabinet approved the changes recommended by the GoM in the new excise policy. Though the LG raised certain objections, and the file went back and forth for two months, the final policy with 12% profit margin for wholesalers was notified on May 25, 2021, CBI said.The agency detailed the trail of alleged kickbacks of Rs 90-100 crore, of which Rs 44.5 crore was sent through hawala channels to Goa and spent on AAP's election campaign.
Article Summary: CBI in an affidavit told the Supreme Court on Friday that he had masterminded increase in wholesalers' commission from 5% to 12% in the 2021-22 excise policy. The agency also opposed grant of interim bail to Kejriwal on health grounds and said he could be treated for his ailments in the jail hospital or any referral hospital as per jail manual.

Article Title: Central hospitals to do away with graduation robe
Article Text: New Delhi: The health ministry issued an order Friday to all Centre-run hospitals, AIIMS and other institutes of national importance to do away with black robe and cap for convocation , calling it a " colonial legacy ". The order said, "This attire originated in the Middle Ages in Europe and was introduced by the British in all their colonies".The institutes will now each design an appropriate Indian dress code for convocation, based on local traditions of the state in which they are located.They will submit proposals for this which will be approved by the Union health secretary.
Article Summary: The order said, "This attire originated in the Middle Ages in Europe and was introduced by the British in all their colonies" The institutes will now each design an appropriate Indian dress code for convocation. They will submit proposals for this which will be approved by the Union health secretary.

Article Title: Making small satellites a piece of cake for these students
Article Text: NEW DELHI: With a tilak on his forehead, a teen was fiddling with a nano satellite , which was small enough to fit in the palm of his hand, and explaining its role to space enthusiasts . B Srinivas was part of a team of 4-5 B.Tech students who set up a stall at a space exhibition at Bharat Mandapam on National Space Day on Friday to showcase their skills in developing nano and microsatellites.Among them, Zeel Gabani, who is also doing aeronautical engineering from the Thiruvananthapuram-based Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology like others, said, “We are not only developing these small satellites , but some of our satellites have already been launched by Isro in space on its experimental platform (POEM).” Isro nowadays uses the fourth stage of its PSLV rocket as an experimental platform after it completes its primary task of launching a satellite. Students use this platform for doing experiments in space.“We are working for the Small-Spacecraft Systems and Payload Centre (SSPACE), which is a spacecraft-making centre within our institute. It is a completely-student initiative,” the girl student said.Another student, Jacob, said a small satellite takes 3-4 years to develop. “As a satellite development is not possible with one batch, so its development is done by generations of students. Our seniors would start work on a satellite. Data is passed on to the second batch. We will work and once we pass out of the college, our juniors will resume work. There is no communication gap as the entire project is documented and our seniors mentor us well on the project even after leaving the campus.”With a smiling face, Jacob boasted that “many of our seniors are now working for Isro and leading startups like AgniKul. Over 100 alumni, now working for Isro, were involved in the Chandrayaan project”.
Article Summary: Isro nowadays uses the fourth stage of its PSLV rocket as an experimental platform. Students use this platform for doing experiments in space. A small satellite takes 3-4 years to develop. Over 100 alumni, now working for Isro, were involved in the Chandrayaan project.
